basics.name: Abdelrahman Abdallah
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate · Machine Learning & NLP
basics.summary: Machine learning engineer and final-year Ph.D. candidate with experience in natural language processing, information retrieval, and computer vision. Passionate about building LLM-based systems, OCR and QA pipelines, and tools that support both research and real-world applications.

work.name: Digital Science Center (DiSC), University of Innsbruck
work.summary: Research assistant working on NLP and information retrieval within the Digital Science Center.
highlights: Knowledge extraction and information retrieval from unstructured text documents.
Methods for natural language processing and information retrieval.
Application of text mining methods to the field of digital history.

work.name: DISCO App
work.summary: Machine learning engineer working on OCR and NLP for digital receipts.
highlights: Worked on receipt extraction, OCR systems, and NLP components.
Built and improved OCR accuracy for receipts and downstream information extraction and classification.
Contributed to an application deployed on the Google Play Store.

work.name: Università Ca' Foscari
work.summary: Researcher working on ML models for climate change and risk assessment.
highlights: Comparative analysis of graph neural networks and random forests for climate-related tasks.
Contributed to a review paper on ML/AI models for risk assessments.
Surveyed graph neural networks for spatio-temporal data.

work.name: KMG Engineering
work.summary: Machine learning engineer focusing on vision and NLP applications.
highlights: Developed GAN-based models for image inpainting.
Built English grammar correction models using deep learning.
Worked on curve detection and tracking tasks.

work.name: National Open Research Laboratory for Information and Space Technologies, Satbayev University
work.summary: Researcher focusing on handwriting recognition, table detection, and document analysis.
highlights: Built handwritten Kazakh and Russian databases for handwriting recognition research.
Reviewed recent approaches to handwritten recognition for Cyrillic characters.
Created a table detection dataset and developed models for table detection and classification.

work.name: Assiut University, Faculty of Computers and Information
work.summary: Research and teaching assistant in Computer Science.
highlights: Taught classes, supervised laboratory sessions, and graded assignments and projects.
Represented teams in meetings with executives to discuss project goals and milestones.
Kept up with emerging technologies and applied them to teaching and research projects.

work.name: CCC at Limkokwing University
work.summary: Software developer working on web applications with database backends.
highlights: Developed and implemented a scanning component using PHP and MySQL.
Designed databases and table structures using n-tier architecture for web applications.
Built web applications using the ExpressionEngine PHP framework.

work.name: FastKood Company
work.summary: Web developer building data-driven websites and internal tools.
highlights: Converted UI mockups into HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, and JSON.
Worked with UNIX and Apache servers.
Developed data architecture designs for targeted customer analysis.
Created workflow charts and diagrams to support production teams and meet client deadlines.

work.name: Overcoffeesolutions
work.summary: Software developer focusing on object-oriented applications.
highlights: Developed object-oriented software and intuitive graphical user interfaces.
Implemented scanning components using MySQL and solid database design.
Built multiple web applications following n-tier architecture.

volunteer.summary: Reviewer for major conferences and journals in NLP, IR, and computer vision.
highlights: Conference reviewer: ACL, SIGIR, COLING, EMNLP, LREC-COLING, WACV.
Journal reviewer: Pattern Recognition Letters, IET NBT, Heliyon, IET Signal Processing.

education.institution: Satbayev University, Faculty of Information and Telecommunication Technologies
Assiut University, Faculty of Computer and Information
Assiut University, Faculty of Computer and Information

awards.title: Scholarship for Master's Studies
awards.summary: Scholarship to study for a Master's degree in Data Science and Machine Learning at Satbayev University.

publications.name: DeAR: Dual-Stage Document Reranking with Reasoning Agents via LLM Distillation
publications.summary: Dual-stage LLM-based document reranking framework using reasoning agents and distillation.

publications.name: How Good are LLM-based Rerankers? An Empirical Analysis of State-of-the-Art Reranking Models
publications.summary: Empirical analysis of modern LLM-based rerankers across multiple datasets and settings.

publications.name: ComplexTempQA: A Large-Scale Dataset for Complex Temporal Question Answering
publications.summary: Large-scale dataset for temporally complex question answering over dynamic collections.

publications.name: RankArena: A Unified Platform for Evaluating Retrieval, Reranking and RAG
publications.summary: Unified platform for benchmarking retrieval, reranking, and RAG pipelines with human and LLM feedback.

publications.name: MultiOCR-QA: Dataset for Evaluating Robustness of LLMs in Question Answering on Multilingual OCR Texts
publications.summary: Dataset designed to test robustness of QA models on noisy multilingual OCR outputs.

publications.name: Wrong Answers Can Also Be Useful: PlausibleQA - A Large-Scale QA Dataset with Answer Plausibility Scores
publications.summary: QA dataset with plausibility scores for both correct and incorrect answers.

publications.name: DynRank: Improving Passage Retrieval with Dynamic Zero-Shot Prompting Based on Question Classification
publications.summary: Dynamic prompting strategy for better zero-shot passage retrieval using LLMs.

publications.name: ASRank: Zero-Shot Re-Ranking with Answer Scent for Document Retrieval
publications.summary: Zero-shot LLM-based reranking approach that uses answer scent signals.

publications.name: CascadePLS-ViT: Cascade With Patch-Level Self-Supervised Vision Transformers for Breast Cancer Classification in Mammography
publications.summary: Patch-level self-supervised ViT cascade for mammographic breast cancer classification.

publications.name: From Retrieval to Generation: Evaluating the Best Approach
publications.summary: Study comparing retrieval-based and generation-based approaches for QA and related tasks.

publications.name: TempDPR: Temporal Dense Passage Retrieval for Explicit Temporal Questions
publications.summary: Temporal dense passage retrieval model for time-sensitive questions.

publications.name: A Survey of Recent Approaches to Form Understanding in Scanned Documents
publications.summary: Survey of transformers and language models for form understanding and scanned document analysis.

publications.name: Evaluating Temporal Robustness of Large Language Models
publications.summary: Evaluation of how LLM performance changes under temporal shifts in data.

publications.name: HiGenQA: Exploring Hint Generation Approaches for Open Domain Question Answering
publications.summary: Study of automatic hint generation strategies for improving open-domain QA.

publications.name: Detecting Temporal Ambiguity in Questions
publications.summary: Detection of temporally ambiguous questions in open-domain QA datasets.

publications.name: IHRRB-DINO: Identifying High-Risk Regions of Breast Masses in Mammogram Images Using Data-Driven Instance Noise (DINO)
publications.summary: DINO-based framework to highlight high-risk regions in mammogram images.

publications.name: ArabicaQA: A Comprehensive Dataset for Arabic Question Answering
publications.summary: Large-scale dataset for Arabic open-domain question answering.

publications.name: Exploring the State of the Art in Legal QA Systems
publications.summary: Comprehensive review of legal question answering systems and datasets.

references.name: References available upon request
references.reference: Academic and professional references can be provided upon request.

projects.name: Rankify
projects.summary: Creator and maintainer of Rankify, a Python toolkit for retrieval, reranking, and RAG evaluation.
highlights: Comprehensive Python package for information retrieval and reranking evaluation.
Supports evaluation of retrieval, reranking, and RAG systems with automated metrics and human feedback.
Integrated with the RankArena platform and has 500+ GitHub stars.

projects.name: RankArena
projects.summary: Lead developer of RankArena, a unified web platform for evaluating retrieval, reranking, and RAG systems.
highlights: Provides standardized protocols for benchmarking IR models against strong baselines.
Supports both human and LLM-based feedback for evaluation.
Accepted at CIKM 2025.
